review: I have been using Elevate for almost a year, and I‚Äôm very proud of my streak there. It‚Äôs a great app, where Elevate schools your brain and is very language oriented, Peak trains the muscles of your brain like focus and memory which may appeal to the broader range of people like me looking to harness more brain strength, and not as much brain intelligence. Peak also has more user interactions, a lot more statistics which is awesome and a great family plan you should look into!
title: Peak vs Elevate

review: Overall, I love this app.  My only complaint is that when it throws new games at you (which you inevitably start at a beginner level), your overall performance rating is severely degraded by the inclusion of the new, low (i.e., beginner) scores.  My overall rating dropped 4 percentage points in the last 2 days because I got 3 first-time games (not the same ones) on consecutive days.  Their ranking algorithm should factor that in and not punish the user for things outside their control (i.e., being given new games).
title: Great App w/1 Flaw

review: I paid for a full year of pro and I got a new phone signed in with Facebook which was linked with my account then realized I didn‚Äôt have access to pro when I messaged them they stated I simply was signed into the wrong account and gave me an email so I signed into tne right account still no sign of my pro working then a deal popped up on my new phone to pay $9.99 for life subscription so I decided what the heck it‚Äôs worth repaying for it at that cost so I agreed and my payment was denied because I already purchased pro so I checked again and I still had no access when I messaged the company yet again I haven‚Äôt heard back anything it‚Äôs been 6 days iTunes is agreeing to refund my money
title: Robbing

review:
Okay, this app has had THE SAME BUG on iOS (at least on iPhone 11‚Ä¶) whereby TAPPING/SELECTING the ‚ÄúGames‚Äù tab, (on the main screen, at the bottom of the app) NEVER LOADS! The Games tab takes me to the ‚ÄúAll Games‚Äù page, but THAT‚ÄôS WHERE IT STOPS WORKING.. The Peak app LITERALLY FREEZES EVERY TIME I tap the ‚ÄúGames‚Äù tab. 

In my honest opinion, this has got to be one of the most epic fails I have ever seen in a mainstream app, mainly because this exact same ‚Äúbug‚Äù has been around FOR AT LEAST 4 MONTHS and STILL HAS NOT BEEN FIXED! It‚Äôs sad, but true. For being one of the most intuitive brain training apps on the market, the developer seems to be COMPLETELY OBLIVIOUS to such an awful problem. This is especially true for paying customers: why don‚Äôt they just fix it?? 

I want to play Peak MY WAY - to be able to pick and choose the games I play & train with. However, UNTIL THE DEVELOPERS ***FIX THE BUG***, I can‚Äôt even begin to explore the full potential of this app. 

Note to the developer:
Please fix said bug ASAP??! üòï

review: This is an awesome app. I haven‚Äôt payed for the full version and I still have fun every day. You definitely don‚Äôt need to pay to get a lot out of this app, like you have to with others of its kind. There is a great variety of games and puzzles and it is very user-friendly. Don‚Äôt be afraid to watch some videos to unlock more games! They aren‚Äôt very long and the games are worth it. Get this app if you are patient and love brain games!
title: Get it if you like brain teasers!

review: Thank you for making this app.  I am straight up addicted and I‚Äôve seen some significant improvements in my cognitive ability after downloading and then upgrading to ‚Äúpro.‚Äù  I am above eighty one percent of my age group (18) and I am rising fast.  I think that the only thing that is holding me back is my lack of fine-motor coordination, but my advancement in my cerebrum is absolutely astounding.  I personally credit PEAK for catalyzing the improvement of my brain.
title: Great tool for increasing cerebral capacity

review:
There are a few things that could improve the user experience.
1. Allow me to set what the time parameters of my ‚Äúday‚Äù. I hate when I mess up a streak because I didn‚Äôt get it before midnight. 
2. For games like Objectifind it would helpful at the end instead of going straight to the score screen if it highlighted or identified the item you were last searching for. 
3. Coordination and Emotion need more than their respective two and three games. I don‚Äôt feel these are enough to accurate score in these categories. 
4. There should be an option to see (in table format, 2-3 columns) each game title, category and rank in one place.  
5. Are there new games coming? Is that an option? I love my subscription but I‚Äôm getting bored. I‚Äôve already long since identified which games are my favorite and which I don‚Äôt like as much.
title: Great but not Amazing

review:
Pretty much everything about this app is great‚Äîthe games are fun, and it feels good to improve in the different areas. But the Coordination games (of which there are only two) are near impossible, on a technical level. The Jump Control (may not actually be the game) is especially difficult. I like to think I‚Äôm pretty good at it, but the game does not do a good job of recognizing how many fingers I have on the screen at one time, or where exactly they are.

Improve that, and you have yourself a really good app!
title: Great, but...

review: The games are great!  I have been playing them for three weeks now and I enjoy the challenges of each one I have played.   But the scoring makes no sense at all. It said I was in the 100th percentile on a game tonight and I played it again and did even better!  But then it said I was in the 23rd percentile!  It‚Äôs like that all the time. Scores are inaccurate and don‚Äôt transfer correctly to my totals. I got it for the good holiday price of $19 for a year though, and I enjoy playing so, oh well.
title: Fun games but scores are inaccurate

review: I have had this app for a few days now and really enjoy it. I like the wide variety of games that challenge me in different ways. Only thing is in the last 8-12 hours I have had 2 different incidences where the game stopped responding to my touch but the timer kept ticking down. I can pause the game and it responds to that touch but won‚Äôt respond to my touch on the actual game field. Other than that little issue it‚Äôs a great way to keep your mind sharp!
title: Fun and challenging with a couple bugs

review:
I don‚Äôt mind ads between games.  I do a lot of games where I watch ads to get free coins/diamonds/lives/whatever.  But the ads here are insane.  I keep my phone on silent, but the ads don‚Äôt adhere to that (like they do in other apps).  So I‚Äôll be sitting playing on silent, then an ad pops up with full unexpected sound!  Then, when the ad is done the App Store automatically opens to download the game.  

This is just too much and I don‚Äôt like the ads have the ability to do whatever they want with my phone, so I‚Äôll be getting rid of Peak.  It‚Äôs a shame because I was really enjoying playing the games.
title: Removing because of ads

review: Been using peak (pro on and off) since summer 2017 and I definitely feel it working. review:
Most of the games are actually geared towards brain training and such... but some really aren‚Äôt. The problem is on object find games when you‚Äôre expected to know what the object looks like to find it. If a ‚Äúdrum kit‚Äù isn‚Äôt a picture of a snare drum, then what is? 
They also have games that discriminate against hearing loss instructing a higher score by listening to the change in sounds. Well, that would mean deaf people aren‚Äôt as smart because they can‚Äôt hear the sound and react faster?
Frankly, play on the free side. Don‚Äôt waste your money on a subscription.

title: Like it

review:
I love this app.
I haven‚Äôt played as regularly as I should, but so far it‚Äôs been great. It definitely helps you figure out your strengths and weaknesses so you can work on them; but it doesn‚Äôt have a lot of focus on your weaknesses. It would be nice if the excercises catered to those.

title: A great app. Worth buying pro.

review:
Peak is how I unwind each day. It‚Äôs what I go to when I need to calm my mind, to shut out everything else, and focus on it. 
  It‚Äôs helped me vastly, with my memory, with relaxation, with self esteem, as I watch myself improving. I cannot express all this app has done for me, helped me  exercised my once, due to prolonged cancer, rather dormant brain.  
  I pay, so I can ‚Äúplay‚Äù whatever I‚Äôm in the mood for, anytime. 1 of the 2 best app‚Äôs I‚Äôve purchased.
title: I‚Äôm so relieved it‚Äôs still around.

review: Honestly. I‚Äôve struggled with attention,memory and performance but since I‚Äôve played the unpro version I have noticed a change in myself. I‚Äôve been more productive during the day finishing things that used to take hours. I finally upgraded to pro and wish I would have done it sooner. The games are always there if I need a pick me up after lunch. Highly recommended! You won‚Äôt regret this purchase!
title: You need this.

review: I loved the app and had it for a couple days before upgrading to Pro. You have options you can go through and it legitimately looks like you‚Äôre subscribing to a monthly charge of about $2.50 or so per month, ok - I‚Äôm fine with that, I thought. Nope! I was hit with an immediate charge of $35 for an entire year. Had I known I‚Äôd be hit with a $35 upfront charge I wouldn‚Äôt have done it. I cancel my subscription through iTunes and it will not allow you to cancel your current subscriptions - only future ones. The way they have this designed is seriously misleading and is a crappy way to run things. If I could give it less than 1 star I would.

There are still some free games per day, but they are not playable because the game now runs full-screen, extremely intrusive and trashy video ads that don‚Äôt always have a clearly marked ‚Äúx‚Äù to close the app.  I don‚Äôt mind some ads; I understand that the app creators need to support themselves, but can you at least try something more tasteful? review:
I purchased the full version when it went on sale, so I have played many of them.  I have found that this is a great app for high school G/T students to hone skills.

There are issues, however.  Some of the categories (like Emotion and Coordination) don‚Äôt have many games, so it is tougher to increase your score.  And specifically, Word Pairs is an incredibly inaccurate game; there are many meanings for the words, so pairs that should match up, don‚Äôt.  

I would love to see some games based on divergent thinking to help hone creative thinking skills, rather than focusing on convergent thinking (right/wrong questions).

It is also important to remember that these games hone very specific skill sets.  For example, if you score low in Emotion doesn‚Äôt mean you aren‚Äôt attuned to people‚Äôs emotions or are not empathetic.  These games rely mostly on speed and fluency in timed settings.
title: Great app, but...

The only thing i like about it is being able to track my score but that, as im told, could not actually reflect how im doing at all, considerig im playing the dame games.

The game is rigged so that no matter how well you do on each game it will find ways to deduct points until you subscribe and then you‚Äôll be a superstar for doing the exact same thing. review: As a Marine who experienced difficulty from injury with memory, I‚Äôve found that by playing this game, my memory has significantly improved. review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for a while now and I‚Äôve gotten to levels in the games where you need to replay the game and get a certain score twice in a row to level up. Recently, when pressing the replay button, it asks me to upgrade to the Pro version and will not let me replay. Before, I could watch an ad in order to replay that game.  Financially I can‚Äôt upgrade to Pro, and if I am not able to level up my games it‚Äôs really going to deter me from playing. 

Otherwise, the app is fun and good. But this is a huge roadblock to my enjoyment of it.

review:

Especially older ones, those with risk of stroke.  You can compare today‚Äôs activities with the past performances it‚Äôs pretty spot on detecting those days I have emotional stress.

review: You can play three short games per day, and then you‚Äôre locked out unless you buy pro.  Pro is a $5/mo subscription, which is very expensive for a small collection of puzzle games.  Many of these are just rip offs of popular free games like flappy bird, word search, and other puzzles.  You can pay $35/year or $100/life to save some money, but that really just puts in perspective what you‚Äôre paying for puzzles. Grab a dozen free puzzle games and play whatever you want when you feel like it.

Having that demo/trial after the instructions would be really helpful, so I can be sure I actually understand the game before I start the training.  Otherwise, I've been really happy with Peak!

Most of the time you‚Äôll be watching ads more than you‚Äôre actually playing the game. It‚Äôs just a sad shell of what it used to be.

title: Money grab

review: I love the app and greatly enjoy the memory games. One thing I would strongly recommend, however, is adding a ‚Äúfavorite games‚Äù function. There are many games, which is a plus, but scrolling through them all and trying to remember their titles seems like an unnecessary hassle if there are 3-4 games that one likes and uses most.

review:
I got this app to share with my son with the intent of competing.  I knew there would be ads while free, but the frequency and duration of the ads is excessive. Most of all, I was surprised by the number of ads for gambling and purchases in a 4+ rated app.  We have also seen crashes fairly often, and it is hard to tell if the ads are a factor.

Instead of the family plan, we settled on the Black Friday lifetime deal for one account, so we can actually see what the app is about.
title: Gambling ads for kids?

review:
Soooo many ads that are so long. And for what? To play one round of a puzzle game you could play for free on another app in the app store? (It‚Äôs just puzzles like picture cross, word scrambles, etc) 

And to make it worse, it actually coaches you on strategies to improve how you do at the game‚Äîinstead of letting you logically deduce these rules yourself. It‚Äôs not so much brain ‚Äútraining‚Äù as coaching on how to be better at specific puzzle games. 

Except maybe it is training, but on how to either waste money or sit through ads that last longer than the games themselves.
title: Ads galore.

Developers need to check a thesaurus for Word Alike. I have an above average vocabulary. Whether asking for similar or opposite meaning of words, either there sometimes is NO correct choice or the 
words are so obscure they are easily missed. I have been using this app for about a year,  purchased a full subscription and thoroughly enjoy it. I do wish there were a few more creative games offered in the Language Category.

review: The games are fun, yet challenging as difficulty increases real-time in-correlation with the individual‚Äôs speed/accuracy. The app does a great job of aggregating results over-time to help the user gauge trends and overall progress.

review:

Update to dev response:
 Cop out answer. They're not short video ads they are intrusive long ads. Longer than the games between the ads, not to mention the extra banners thrown on top of the ads to block the timers/force you to go to their store page to get you more clicks

There are ways to improve the customer experience so they WANT to support you, rather than choke people until they're forced to either purchase or uninstall, I'd still be building my streak on a daily basis if it wasn't for those ads, getting me closer and closer to buying in to spend more time training, now it's just an uninstalled forgotten app

review:
Great app! A few feature requests please

1. It would be great if there is an option to turn off vibration in the app. For example, in the Low-Pop game, if an incorrect sort order is selected, the app causes the phone to vibrate. It would be great if this can be turned off through an option.

2. I‚Äôd love to have a pro mode where some of the animations are turned off, to avoid waiting, and save some time. Eg: the countdown before starting each game. 

3. Dark mode support would help a lot. Totally understandable that the game colors themselves cannot be changed easily. What i was hoping for was an option where the bright white screens can be turned dark.

No I‚Äôm not moving my fingers around while they‚Äôre on the screen.

title: Fun...but does not seem to remember my scores correctly..

review:
Many of the games‚Äô scores rely on luck or a particular perspective (e.g. any of the word association games depend on the user associating the same set of words, or the blimp spelling game relying on spawning usable letters). Also, despite blowing past the target scores you can still lose points if you have an off day - *plus* it‚Äôs highly disproportionate. I might double the target score, but if it‚Äôs 5% lower than yesterday I‚Äôll still lose 10 points off my category score.

I can‚Äôt attach a screen caps, but I just got three new high scores and two rank ups for a grand total of +9 across four categories. 

Yesterday I lost 10 points in one category for scoring about 15% lower on one game (out of three I played in the category) than I did previously. 

It‚Äôs nonsensical.

review: This is a video game. It doesn't show how smart you are or how talented you are at what you love. Stop wasting time with letting video games determine your brainpower. You have unlimited brainpower. Use it pursuing your passion. Don't seek outside approval of your God-given amazing brain. We all have unique talents and abilities. Stop comparing yourself to others. This app is all about comparing you to others to make you addicted to the competitiveness of the game. Don't give in. Use your time wisely. Einstein probably would have sucked at this game lol and still gone down in history as a genius ;)
title: Want to get smarter? Read books don't play video games

review:
Pros: great presentation and variety of games, achievements and comparing scores is fun. No external ads is nice. 

Cons: can only play 3-5 pre-selected games once, and only one time per day, unless you pay for Pro as a monthly subscription (yuck) or one-time $100 charge (double yuck); game sandbags your score initially so you feel inclined to pay and play. 

It‚Äôs a really nice-looking game, but there are so many comparable and less expensive/free ‚Äúbrain training‚Äù apps out there that paying to use this one makes no sense.
title: Great for literally 5 min/day

review:
Honestly- the appearance of this is geared towards children and it would be embarrassing to get caught playing it as an adult. 

It‚Äôs extremely repetitive in the sense that the word search for example has a lot of the same words across different categories, and there‚Äôs only like 15 categories. Never get new categories. If I was playing a free version I wouldn‚Äôt care, but I‚Äôm paying for it.  Actually, what brought me here was to turn off auto-payments so it doesn‚Äôt renew next time.  Can‚Äôt find that on the app itself. Said it has to be done from the App Store (???)

review: I‚Äôve had this app for 3 months, and it is by far the best app I‚Äôve purchased.  Lots of variety.  I love the puzzles.  My brain map improvement is phenomenal. This helps me with focus, dealing with depression and anxiety, problem solving, and I‚Äôm even less of a klutz.  I highly recommend, and have even to total strangers.  Oh, and by the way, there‚Äôs a great collection of jigsaw puzzles I love to play to relax.

review: I‚Äôm not a big game player, but I have found myself looking forward to the time I make for myself to play or complete my workouts. I have a family history of early onset dementia (specifically Alzheimer‚Äôs) which was my main drive to engage in the process of improving my mental abilities. Now my reason for playing is catharsis

review:
Why did I give this app such a low rating? Because of usability. Unless you pay for it, you are not going to get to play much of this at all. Not only that, but it‚Äôs a subscription, can we all agree that we have plenty of that in our lives without having it in a game? 

You want us to pay, pay for the app, have in app purchases, but it‚Äôs lame to have to subscribe. 

The games are fun, but there are other apps that do this that have loads of content available for free users. Make more stuff available and more people will want to do it, and you might have more paying.

Every official test I‚Äôve ever taken has ranked my language skills as low and my problem solving and special recognition as high, this app tells me the opposite so I can only assume there is some bunk science going in here. Most of the games are fun though.

review:
This app was better than the others I‚Äôve tried (I was actually even considering paying for premium until today). You had four random games to play to finish a daily workout and then you could see your stats, checking progress, and even compare with others in your age-range for free! If you wanted to replay a game or just play a game that wasn‚Äôt part of your ‚Äúdaily workout‚Äù, you just had to watch an ad. There were some ‚Äúpro-only‚Äù games, but nothing to be upset over.
I regret not leaving a review during the years Peak was mostly free. 

‚Äì  Now, stats are behind a paywall/ad video.
Game replays are locked behind a paywall. 

‚Äì On the positive side, only playing two grants for a daily workout is much more convenient. I still get to ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù the day and use half the time.

title: I do not recommend this game...

review: Hello my daughter has been playing this game, and she loves it.    Whoever made this game should be proud of themselves. My daughter has learned so much from this game, and she's only five. She's been learning how to memorize, use her emotions, and much more. This is the best game for your children to play when they have free time. The best thing about this game is that adults can play the game too.
title: It's the best skill game I know

review: So far I like this app lot. I wish they would give you the option to do more or do repeats without having to spend money to buy it. Or at least make it where you could buy a couple months at a time instead of having to buy an entire year. I do like the games so I will keep using it. I doubt I‚Äôll buy it though. It hasn‚Äôt impressed me that much yet
title: Pretty good but could be better

review: Over the years, I have taken so much chemo therapy drugs for a disease I had that I feel so brain dead. I am only 23! When I saw this game, I wanted to give it a try in hopes to boost/ improve my brain activity! So far, this game seems like it has been helping me! I recommend this to those who need it and for those who just want to be challenged! It's a fun way to improve yourself!
title: Awesome!

review: Let's you play one round of a handful of games (which you cannot choose). Won't let you play again or choose another game (unless you buy pro) because your "workout" for the day is complete. The next day, it gives you completely different games for your workout, so you still can't play a second round of anything from day 1. Everything you try to do bedsides playing one round of the day's prescribed games requires you to pay to upgrade. It's just stupid. Deleting app.
title: Pointless. Have to pay to play.

review:
I want to believe solving puzzles and playing logic games builds better cognitive function, but every research report I've read says it ain't so. 

So I'm left recommending Peak because it's fun, and a lot of imagination has gone into designing it. If Peak can't make you smarter, it will at least reassure you that your brain can still learn to do stuff.
title: Clever & Fun
developerResponse: {'id': 31391731, 'body': 'Hello GoodOldMonkey! Thank you for taking the time to review us :-) we are happy that you are enjoying Peak!', 'modified': '2022-08-10T16:47:11Z'}

review: I love this app. It really started helping my brain, even after a couple of days. You don‚Äôt need to buy the subscription to have the right tools. review: Elevate is definitely a better game but the lifetime purchase option on this game is a much better price than renting a game each month. I played elevate for about 4 years and those monthly rental/usage fees really rack up.
title: Overall pretty good. Latest update causes game to crash after individual game score report

review:
The games are kinda fun, but the idea of a month subscription... to play games seems idiotic. A one time fee is more that sufficient.
They get you thinking it‚Äôs good to pay because you‚Äôre strengthening your brain, but the reality is... you‚Äôre playing games (which may or may not help keep your mind fit) and they are just keeping stats a little better than the other games you play, and putting you in categories. The monthly payments is such a scam! Surely it doesn‚Äôt cost them THAT much to develop in order to justify monthly payments? Anyway, long story short. I‚Äôm deleting it!
title: Waste of money.

review: I‚Äôm a senior my short term memory slim to nonexistent. Since playing this game it has made me feel good and happy that I can review my progress. review: Nice games, but to play this you must swim through a seemingly endless barrage of long advertisements. I understand that is a revenue stream, but 30 seconds (!) before each game (!) is an absurd level of advertising. I give up. Competing products are considerably less annoying on the advert front. Fewer adverts or shorter (5 - 10 seconds) would be greatly welcomed. Seriously, who watches 30 second ads anymore?

review: I get that developers want to make money. But I don‚Äôt want a subscription. I‚Äôm happy to watch a few video ads once in a while. But this game has gone from offering a few free games per day to requiring a video ad I between each ‚Äúfree‚Äù game to now making you watch a full 30 second ad just to see your score on a ‚Äúfree‚Äù game. This is a perfect example of an ad experience making this app unusable. I‚Äôll sadly be deleting.
title: Great games, terrible ad experience

review:
i understand free apps have ads, but the daily workouts are about 1/3 ads. i play a minute long game, then watch a thirty second ad before the next one. mess up a ton and want to restart? ad. exit game because you have to do something else? another ad to play the game you already unlocked. it is ridiculous. peak used to be fun, only about one ad every workout that lasted 10-15 seconds. now, there are at least three that last twice as long. 

the game does work, i have noticed improvements in my focus and memory, but the statistics are off. there is no way i‚Äôm ont he 96th percentile when my much more logical-minded brother is in the 60th. 

in conclusion, it works but not as much as it says and not without billions of ads.
title: it works, but there are too many ads

review:
Peak certainly provides hours of mindless fun, but its contention that using it actually improves cognitive performance are suspect.  As a clinician, I have yet to see that using programs like PEAK improves cognitive performance demonstrated in a double-blinded study.  Until that happens, this will be nothing more than what it is: something to occupy idle hands on long flights.  

Furthermore, how it assigns ‚Äòimprovements‚Äô in any of the cognitive domains seems decidedly unidimensional - how can one play ANY of these games without improving one‚Äôs scores on at least two (and possibly three) metrics, particularly when all of the games are timed?
title: Mindless Fun

review:
I think that this is the best app that I have on my iPad! It encourages you to work harder and stay focused in everything that you do like activities, school, etc.

I do think that since this a great app that you should be able to play more than four games a day, and don‚Äôt have to pay for them. But besides that, this is a great appüòò

review: I had a stroke over a year and a half ago. I was one of the luckier ones as I recovered slowly but surely. I like the variety and the little goals I can go after in each game. Over 4 stars!

review: I've been using this app for over a month now. I love how it tracks your progress. You can see which categories you need to improve on and the ones you exceed in. You can also compare your scores to others! The games are fun and they don't take very long if you have a busy schedule.
title: Fun games, worth the subscription

review: A first I didn't think this would help me until I saw the areas in my brain that needed help. I love the graphs that you can compare yourself to rest in your age group. The graphics are pretty good. Some of the games are addictive! I'm very happy I signed up! I am improving every time I play. Granted, I do have bad days but over all I have improved.

review:
It's sound fun, very challenging but sooooo fun at the same time. It really helps you focus. You don't have to pay but it would be totally worth it. highly highly recommend this app!!

They completely ruined the game. There is so much going on it is very difficult to keep up and understand what is happening. There is a lot of flashy visuals but it is not user friendly any more. Also now to replay the games you have to play. Was once great but not anymore.

After waiting longer than usual for the app to download I played a few easy short games and 2 minutes later I couldn‚Äôt play anymore unless I signed up for a monthly subscription.  You can only do a daily assessment and can‚Äôt do any actual exercises without paying.

Do not label your app as ‚Äúfree‚Äù when it is pointless unless you pay money!! Completely misleading and false advertising!!

review: The games are a lot of fun, but don‚Äôt let the ‚Äúfree‚Äù sign fool you, you‚Äôre expected to pay. The app only allows you to play a couple games, of their choice, one time a day. They then compare you to people who played the games hundreds of times to make you feel like you really need to work on it. There are a lot of ways this app tries to charge you. Want to replay a game? Charged. Want to try a new game? Charged. Everything is behind a pay wall and that‚Äôs something I just can‚Äôt support.

review:
I‚Äôm an investor in digital therapeutics and digital health, so thought I‚Äôd try this game out. It‚Äôs easy and fun and has the addictive properties to keep engagement, but it doesn‚Äôt have training techniques and tips to get better or insights on how to improve. It simply assumes that by playing more games you will magically get better, but most people hit a peak and can‚Äôt continue to learn or improve without feedback on how to do better. 

Also no area to ask questions. Typical of tech based platforms.
title: Great Game, No Training

title: Why is there only 1 game for ‚Äúcoordination‚Äù?

title: Michael‚Äôs Review for Peak

review: I was a legend for years at word fresh, babble bots, and a few others. Now, it says I have to rank up to be a legend. It doesn‚Äôt tell how to rank up, and when I get high scores I don‚Äôt rank up. The old version of your app was just fine. I suggest you revert to the old version.
title: Bad update
developerResponse: {'id': 26824328, 'body': 'Hi there! Oh no! Sorry about this issue. :-( Would you mind sending us a message to support@peak.net? This way, we will be able to support you better. Thanks a lot!', 'modified': '2021-12-14T10:18:26Z'}

review: So I liked the game at first when I did the assessment, played well, was challenging, I was doing great but then it asked me if I would like to pay for 1 month. There was a ‚Äúspecial saying 1 month for 3 dollars but it didn‚Äôt say that I would have to pay for a full year up front. I thought I spent 3 dollars for a month but ended up taking 37 dollars from my bank for the year. Shouldn‚Äôt give a monthly price then charged in full for a full year. title: Price?

review: I‚Äôm a Peak enthusiast due to the large variety of games, goals, and functionality, besides the fact my brain skills stay alive and aware thanks to Peak challenging them! If a few busy days go by without time for Peak, I get back as soon as I can. Peak has become a mainstay in my personal life!

review: ive been using Peak's Pro service for over 1 year now and I can def vouch for its effectiveness! These games really do work out your brain like a dojo for your mind and they're super fun. I can literally feel the cognitive improvement in my everyday life (memory, focus, etc) and when i dont play the game i def feel sluggish again at times. This is literally the gym for your brain...dont slack! üí™üèæüß†
title: IT WORKS!

review: This is an amazing app that really gets you into the workout while showing clearly your progress. The only thing is a lot of very convenient stuff is part of the PRO membership which I can understand. Overall this is a great thing for adults and children

title: Truly Unique

review: Go Pro! Seriously it‚Äôs worth the subscription! I‚Äôm a pro user and love this app! It‚Äôs fun and I‚Äôm exercising my brain all in one! I ‚Äúexercise‚Äù in the morning when I can! The coffee break exercise during the day is perfect for an added boost! The puzzles! Love them! They‚Äôre perfect when you just want to relax but be focused all in one! This app is truly amazing!

However, I hate that you can only play 5 different games once a day. I feel that it is misleading by saying it‚Äôs FREE, but having EVERYTHING but 1% of the app is on PRO and must be paid for. I wouldn‚Äôt even mind if I could play the 5 games I‚Äôm able to more than once a day. Just pretty disappointed in being cornered into paying.
title: It‚Äôs NOT free

review:
As much as I love this app, I get really annoyed as it selectively considers Proper Nouns in some language games (word fresh) while not in the others..(grow)
I also think there are way too less games for improving co-ordination..there are like just 2 games which don't even pop up in the workout that often..

Only to realize that you have to upgrade to ‚Äúpro‚Äù to get everything, and see that‚Äôs not even the problem, I expected that, what i didn‚Äôt expect is the fact that you can‚Äôt just ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù to pro, it‚Äôs not a one time payment thing, it‚Äôs a subscription, and you pay monthly. I immediately stopped using it and this have deleted the app. Not just p‚Äùpay to play.‚Äù it‚Äôs ‚Äúpay monthly to play.‚Äù

title: Amazing

title: Great start

review:
The issue was fixed after my last review and worked for a day or two. Now it just had a loading circle on the main page and games won‚Äôt load. 

 I love this game and plan on buying the full version when the next sale comes along. 
BUT, since the last update it does nothing but crash. Over and over. Sometimes I can make it work for a game if I turn off my iPad and turn it back on again. Once I leave the app, it will just crash again as soon as I try to start the app again. 
I have contacted customer service but just got some canned response that has nothing to do with what I (and many others) are experiencing.

Please fix this ASAP and not wait until the weekly or bi weekly update for the app.
title: Fixed but now just has a loading sign

review: I really enjoy this app, but I will never tolerate something that makes me feel scammed out of my time. My time being made to watch ads in order to play a game I enjoy, then denying to allow me to play said game. I literally watched 2 ads, one to exit out of a game and post my score, then went back to replay the game, watched another ad, then got denied to play after watching another ad. title: Great game!

review:
I got the info for this app from Facebook. I followed link and played for two hours on free version. I updated and have been enjoying it ever since! 
It‚Äôs got puzzles/games for every strength out there and the workouts challenge you to keep improving to become your best!
title: Subscribe -it‚Äôs worth it!

review: The app is phenomenal, but the only way to subscribe for the Pro is in one sum payment per year. I‚Äôd have spent the money if I could do a monthly payment, or even a 3 month payment, because of the flexibility. Now, I won‚Äôt spend a dime because I don‚Äôt want to do a full year plan all at once. Only flaw I‚Äôve found with the app, but a big one at that.
title: Service

review: From the moment I saw its ads on snapchat, I knew this was nothing but BS and boy was I right.  Wanna get smart?  Well how about you start taking pre-school level puzzles called workouts.  Whats that?  You wanna play, ahem, WORKOUT again?  What do you think this is, an actual puzzle app?  Pay up!  But don‚Äôt worry, we know you‚Äôll pay.  Because we know our demographic.  People who are insecure about how smart they are and think they can train their mind an easy way.  This app is like diet pills with micro transactions.  Here‚Äôs one star.  I hope you choke on it.
title: Lies

review: This game is soooo good and I encourage you all to get it. It has fun games that make you want to play more. The only thing is that if you want to play more games than your workout every day, you have to pay for a membership. What about having some games for membership only?
title: Almost Perfect

review: This app was recommended to me by my therapist after I had a mild stroke to help me recover mental abilities to help me recover to be able to be well enough to return to work. It has been a great help to help me recover and point out which areas I am having the most difficulty and what I need to concentrate on to help with recovery.
title: Great stroke recovery tool

review: I have paid each year for this app. I do like it and enjoy the games, the only thing after 2 years it‚Äôs boring. There are no updates to the games, no new games ‚Ä¶.nothing‚Ä¶during Christmas there is one added game which is taken off after the seasons over. I am seriously considering canceling my subscription out of sheer boredom.
title: Sad subscriber

Cool game nonetheless.

All in all I have improved. I would be better in language though if I could full credit for my progress.

I will never even consider purchasing something from an advertiser that uses such an annoying approach to peddle their wares. 2. If Peak doesn‚Äôt remove this ‚Äúfeature‚Äù quickly, I will move to a product that respects its users more by not using such tactics.

title: Great mental calisthenics

Some games are fun, but the irritating ones make me just want to delete this app permanently. Not worth the $5.99 for first year.

title: Simple and effective but

review: Many of the games are fun to play when they come up in rotation. Pay no attention to that score because half the word games are testing how well you can text rather than any other skill. While the games are fun, this is a company that couldn‚Äôt care less about its customers. Monthly cost is close to premium movie channel.
title: Good games. Bad philosophy.
developerResponse: {'id': 33811403, 'body': 'Hi peacehammer123! Thanks for taking the time to write a review for us. We are happy to hear that you like our games, but we are very sorry to hear that you\'re not enjoying the philosophy of Peak. Would you mind explaining to us what you mean by "we have limited access with recent developments"? Do you mean the switch a while back when we introduced ads to the free version? You should be able to unlock more games by watching ads if you are in the free version. To keep providing a free version for Peak, we\'re trying to find ways to monetise the app with ads to enable us to keep working on the app without our users having to buy Peak Pro. If this is not the case for you and you cannot unlock games by watching ads, we are happy to look into this for you. You can reach us at support@peak.net, and one of our CS agents will help you. Regarding our word games, you can find what each game trains when you click on a game and scroll to "Helps you train". We also have more information about our language category when you click on "Me" -> click on the little cogwheel in the top right corner and scroll to "The Science Of Peak". While we do not intend to help train texting speed or how well people text with our language games, this might be a welcome side effect üòÅ. We base our pricing on other similar brain training apps on the market, so if you look to train your brain, you will find that Peak is priced fairly when you compare our app to our competitors. We care a lot about our customers, so we are sad to hear that you feel otherwise; please feel free to send us an email with your suggestion on what we can improve in the app to change your mind (if you like). We wish you a happy festive season! üéÑ', 'modified': '2022-12-19T16:09:27Z'}

title: Peak

review: Ok I got this game excited to strengthen my brain. Well it only lets you play the games when you set a work out time. I would have to pay 35 dollars to play unlimited but that‚Äôs only a year, for a lifetime it‚Äôs 100 bucks. Wayyyyy to much!!! Otherwise I say it‚Äôs a fun game.

review: Of all the brain games I play, I enjoy the Peak games more than all the others. They are imaginative, challenging and fun. I also love the way it shows your rank compared with other users. title: Great Games

review: The games are interesting, but I feel that it‚Äôs not worth my time to jump through hoops in order to level each of them up to the point where they‚Äôre hard enough to feel like a mental exercise.  I also don‚Äôt like how your overall score across all games artificially increases over time as you level up your games and thus unlock greater scoring potential.
title: Contrived

Some games like Elevate are very challenging and should be played if you're actually trying to get a lot smarter. But if you want to have fun and enhance your skills at the same time, you've come to the right place.

review: Although ‚ÄúPeak‚Äù steadily ‚Äî at times frustratingly ‚Äî challenges my quite damaged brain (via a life-altering C19 battle in late Fall, 2020), it‚Äôs that very fact which I appreciate, and am so grateful for. ‚ÄúPeak‚Äù does not lower its standards, nor expectations, at any point. review: After 3 years of using peak subscription and the add-on of the family plan I‚Äôm not going to renew this time. First, I don‚Äôt feel the app give a positive feedback. review: I wake up in the morning and play this game to get my brain going. I played the non pro game for about a year before going pro at Thanksgiving with their black Friday special life time deal. Its nice to have the new games now. Try the game for free and see if you like it... and then go pro.

review: I used to be so smart and quick in high school. After seven years of college, I wondered where my brain went. No matter what I never felt like I had the brain I used to. It felt so disorganized and slow. These games have improved all of my skills so much, and they‚Äôre so fun

review:
The language games are very off - many words missing and strange words, including racial slurs, allowed. Very British English-centric but even so, just inarguably wrong in some places,  such as Word Pairs. This is really bad as it's training people inaccurately.

Also....Most games could use some variation at this price - please add new versions!

In general, Peak is fun, but to take it seriously would be a mistake. It should not be sold as science given so many inaccuracies.

review:
So, I‚Äôve been paying for this service for years.  I put up with being harassed for reviews.  I put up with be constantly coerced to do what *they* wanted me to do. 

I was a Grand Master at some games.  A Legend for years at another.  I constantly scored at the 99th and 100th percentile.  

I logged in today and was told that I was close to leveling up.  At the game that I‚Äôve been a Legend at for years.   I threw the app away and relaunched.  Three times.  Same result.  I restarted the phone and relaunched the app.  Same result. 

Bye.  

If you can‚Äôt do something as simple as keeping score, what else can‚Äôt you do?   I don‚Äôt want to know.  And I‚Äôm not paying you for the privilege.  

From a business perspective, you‚Äôre morons.

review:
Decoder game consistently doesn‚Äôt respond to my touch. It‚Äôs not my phone because it also does it on my wife‚Äôs phone. It‚Äôs something within the game itself.

review: Great game! It really challenges you and gets your mind going! The only flaw is that you have to wait until the next day to do more exercises, unless you upgrade to pro. I would like it if everyone was able to keep practicing, but I guess they have to make their money somehow.

review: I‚Äôve never seen such a scam of an app before. Most apps that are free, give a touch of value to their user and then ask if they want to upgrade. This app simply won‚Äôt let you even try it out before demanding $34. How do you expect users to trust you, if you flat out lie to them when they download? We are looking for a brain training software/app to purchase for our 2400 employees as a fun competition with bonuses and such, but there Much better options out there for brain training.
title: Scam

review: In the past, I have played this game which had more free games. Now it‚Äôs not as many unless you pay for the full access. review: I updated the app today. When I went to play the game Grow...every single word was unacceptable. Including words like club, clue and clutter. I deleted the app. Downloaded it again. Forgot my password and am still waiting for the email that will update my password. Very frustrating.

review: All the games I have played so far have been really fun.  They are just challenging enough to move you away from your comfort zone.  I have been working at this for a few days, and have already improved some.

review: I love this app. I really enjoy the brain games and how they track the progress for you. I have a lot of fun excelling in the games and challenging myself. I would highly recommend this Peak to everyone of any age to try out.

review: Peak is a diversified group of mind exercises. I find them challenging but not overwhelming. I usually "don't pay to play" but I broke my rule with Peak. I think it is worth the fee to play at will without the ads. I use the games/workout daily. I find them relaxing.

So I went to cancel my subscription and 1) I don‚Äôt think I got a refund 2) the official paying site said that it was $5 per month. So in conclusion, I am pretty mad that they lied about 2 things and I hope they see this so I can get my money back. (I only had Peak Plan Pro for 1 day)

1 star actually = 0

More and more features have been taken away to be pro exclusive, the app has never really adjusted it‚Äôs scoring system to recognize really good scores as opposed to slightly off ones, and now there is more ads than ever before.

If you‚Äôre looking for a brain training app and you‚Äôre willing to drop money on a subscription to play connect four for five minutes a day, be my guest. But if you‚Äôre here to even attempt the free trial version, just don‚Äôt bother.

I signed out and created a new account. I destroyed all the assessment games and was in above 95 percentile for all of them, but again, they scored me poorly in a few areas. Total ripoff and feel cheated. But maybe that was the real test of my intelligence and I failed since I bought a subscription

review: The weak attempts to get you to buy are not THAT intrusive. Most of the mini games are solid. However only thing keeping me from a 4-5 star rating is the BROKEN mini game ‚ÄúPartial Match‚Äù literally just deleted the app because It told me I had the wrong response like 7 times. Your devs need to investigate this bs. Great idea here, lots of potential.

The games for the most part are intuitive, however they have finer points to them and it‚Äôs not always clear how to play or what the main focus is. For the game Grow I am still unclear if I need to order my words from shortest to longest to maximize my score ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

review:
I think it‚Äôs easier if K just list my pros and cons. 

Pros: 
  No annoying pop ups
  Actually seeing improvement
  Games are fun
  Many different levels of comparison
  Easy instructions
  Easy charts to understand 
  Challenging, but not competitive
  Positive feedback

Cons:
  Some games are missing from the score list (Word Hunt)
  Can‚Äôt edit your profile after you‚Äôve created it
   The <19 age group is highly unspecific. Kindergarteners and High Schoolers shouldn‚Äôt have to be compared to eachother

review:
I liked Peak very much at first. I started with several days per week, and then started playing everyday. Today was day 80. 

First, I find some of the directions unclear. In turtle traffic, why does most of the game not have a second card to tap? Have I misunderstood and I‚Äôm supposed to be tapping one single card? Several games seem to be like this. The game will be harder if the directions aren‚Äôt clear. 

I‚Äôm scoring under my age group. But I just tried Luminosity and I‚Äôm at the high end of my age group. Guess who I like better? 

I‚Äôll be cancelling Peak as soon as I try a few other apps.
title: Not loving it ‚Ä¶
developerResponse: {'id': 25609314, 'body': 'Hi Ravlef, we are sorry that some of our game instructions are not as clear as they should be; thanks for flagging this up! Regarding the bonus cards, please have a look here for a more detailed explanation: https://peaklabs.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360013611818-Bonus-Cards. While Lumosity and Peak are both Brain Training Apps, we do calculate things differently, so this is why you might not see the same results on both apps. If we can help with anything else, please do not hesitate to contact us via support@peak.net. Thanks for your review! :-)', 'modified': '2021-10-11T09:16:32Z'}

review:
I don‚Äôt care how good your app is. If your goal is to force me to succumb to a paywall to get better content, your goal isn‚Äôt to train my brain. Your goal is conditioning me to open my wallet.

Plus what athlete does a single drill once and leaves it? Not any respectable one. If you want to train something, you keep drilling it until you‚Äôve improved. So if I need to play 6 days in a row to take another crack at low pop, I might as well be trying it for the first time.

I was very impressed with the quality of the challenges presented until I was handed the developer‚Äôs walls.

No thank you, go train some other people.

review: This is just a trick to force you to spend money. After taking the prognosis test, I was told on the memory test the average score is 67% where I got 100%. It then gave me a really low percentile for my brain map. As someone who qualifies for Mensa, I know I am not only in the 58th percentile, so I know my current brainmap from the app was just a marketing tool to try and get me to pay the exorbitant subscription cost. Don‚Äôt fall for it.
